xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #medsavant on 15 June 2013
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu> has joined #medsavant 12:28 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 12:33 <bvancea> has joined #medsavant 12:40 <sdumitriu> Hey bvancea 12:40 <sdumitriu> How's it going? 12:41 <bvancea> hello sdumitriu 12:41 <bvancea> pretty good 12:41 <bvancea> just got my internet back 12:41 <bvancea> :D 12:41 <sdumitriu> Cool 12:41 <bvancea> I'm looking for different sized .vcf files 12:41 <bvancea> to index 12:41 <bvancea> :) 12:41 <bvancea> and how are you? 12:42 <sdumitriu> Good 14:04 <bvancea> nice 14:04 <bvancea> did you apply it to all the files? 14:06 <sdumitriu> No 14:06 <sdumitriu> Just a package 14:06 <sdumitriu> I'm working on a NetBeans codestyle configuration file 14:07 <bvancea> ah, I see 14:22 <bvancea> did you do any solr performance testing on phenotips? 14:22 <bvancea> I've only tested using Solr meter, not sure what the best approaches are 14:38 <sdumitriu> Nope, but we don't have that much data yet to require performance testing 14:39 <sdumitriu> But it works fast enough for what we need 14:39 <sdumitriu> I mean sure, we had to add a cache for term access 14:40 <sdumitriu> But queries return in under 10ms usually 14:41 <bvancea> ah, I see 14:41 <bvancea> 10ms without the cache? 14:41 <bvancea> or with the cache? 14:41 <sdumitriu> Yes 14:41 <sdumitriu> WIthout 14:41 <bvancea> nice 14:41 <sdumitriu> It's queries 14:43 <bvancea> I've tested a bit on the 200k documents index 14:43 <bvancea> there's spikes of up to 2s 14:44 <bvancea> when searching for 2 different terms, dna_id and id
